availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Andrew Hendricks (Shelbyville, Shelby County, Indiana, attorney)

body.p: Shelbyville, Shelby County, Indiana, attorney. Zanesville, Ohio native. Son of John Hendricks and Jane Hendricks. Married to Eliza C. Morgan Hendricks in Hamilton County, Ohio, on September 25, 1845. Father of Morgan Hendricks. Graduated from Hanover College in Jefferson County, Indiana, in 1841. Attorney in Shelby County in 1850. Attorney in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Shelby County, Shelbyville, p. 359A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Shelby County, Shelbyville, p. 826.
Hendrick, Charles T. Daniel Hendrick of Haverhill, Mass. and his Descendants, with a an Appendix Containing Brief Accounts of Several Other Hendrick Families Rutland, VT: The Tuttle Company, 1923.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344457, p. 145.
"Thomas A. Hendricks" (1819-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 2111, accessed May 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/2111.
